intro: Conyza multiflora, commonly known as the common horseweed, is an annual flowering plant native to Africa, Asia, and Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring slender stems and alternate leaves that are usually hairy and lance-shaped. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Conyza multiflora is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain regions.
